newsitem.title: KENYA: Rebel radio says Kabila to address Zaire.
newsitem.headline: Rebel radio says Kabila to address Zaire.

text.p: Zairean rebel leader Laurent Kabila will address the nation on Saturday on the rebel position on political developments and the transition of power in Zaire, rebel radio said.
Rebel Voice of the People radio said Kabila, leader of the Alliance of Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Congo-Zaire (AFDL), would broadcast from Zaire's second city of Lubumbashi.
It gave no time for the address.
"The management of the transition will definitely be dealt with during the address," added the radio, monitored by the British Broadcasting Corporation.

"But already, on that particular point, we all know that the ADFL's position has not changed: the transition must be conducted without Mobutu or the Mobutists and under the Alliance's leadership," the radio added.

On Friday, Zaire's veteran leader Mobutu Sese Seko departed the capital for his northern jungle stronghold and it was announced that he had left his emergency-rule government in charge of national policy while keeping the title of president.
Kabila earlier on Saturday told Reuters his forces, singing as they marched, were entering the Zairean capital Kinshasa from the airport about 25 km (16 miles) away.
There was no confirmation of the report.
